executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Revenue for the industry is expected to increase at a CAGR of 3.9% to $6.6 billion going into 2023, including a rise of 0.8% in 2023 alone. Demand for carpet cleaning services has improved over this period as growth in household formation rates has expanded the available client base for industry operators and rising per capita disposable income has enabled consumers to purchase cleaning services. Additionally, from 2017 to 2020, declining office vacancy rates, increasing nonresidential construction activity and growth in the number of businesses have broadened operators' potential client base in the business sector, as more office and retail space naturally increased demand for commercial carpet cleaning services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue in the Industry is Rising
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Carpet cleaning service demand is primarily correlated with changes in per capita disposable income, consumer spending, business profit and the number of US households and companies. By 2023, these forces will have grown as more consumers will have more disposable income due to higher employment and income levels. Households have chosen professional carpet cleaning services over less expensive, do-it-yourself options because they have more money to spend. The expansion of businesses has also contributed to an increase in market income for commercial carpet cleaning.

The industry is threatened over the long term by the rising popularity of hardwood and alternative flooring. Although the main draw of hardwood flooring is its looks, buyers are also drawn to it because of its extended lifespan. Laminate flooring, which includes luxury vinyl tile and vinyl sheets, is another alternative to carpeting that has grown in popularity over the past several years. Although laminate flooring products usually cost half as much as traditional hardwood flooring, they are just as durable and have a wood appearance.

Small-scale operators have become more prevalent in the industry, partly due to the industry's low entry hurdles and low start-up costs. Most carpet cleaning businesses have just one location and one to two staff members. Most carpet cleaning businesses are situated in locations with more than 100,000 households near and conduct their business locally. As of 2023, small and large carpet cleaners have changed prices. Despite a little rise in sector employment over the last five years, carpet cleaning is still a labor-intensive job.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The industry will experience growth in the outlook period
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Growth in the industry will mostly be driven by increasing rates of home and business creation and the ongoing high demand for disinfection services associated with the COVID-19 pandemic. As more government expenditure improves economic circumstances and corporate sentiment, the benefits of rising employment and a rebound in the commercial market are anticipated to exceed these obstacles.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: There will be changing consumer preferences and industry challenges
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The ongoing use of hardwood and laminate flooring in residences will harm business prospects. The fact that hardwood or laminate flooring can considerably increase a home's value is one reason why more homeowners have chosen to install it. Additionally, laminate is significantly less expensive than hardwood, which adds to its appeal to homeowners. Janitorial companies that bundle carpet cleaning into their service offers for customers are another fierce competitor in the market. This outside rivalry will probably temper the expansion of industrial establishment during that time.

industry_definition: The Carpet Cleaning industry includes establishments that clean rugs, carpets and upholstery for residential and commercial clients. Companies in the industry also provide a range of other services including dyeing used rugs, damage restoration services, ventilation duct cleaning and other cleaning services.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady Barriers To Entry Level

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Per capita disposable income

key_trends: Industry players compete primarily on the basis of pricing, service level, speed, and other services provided. In the industry, there is a lot of price-based competition.
The primary source of external competition for the industry is janitorial service providers that add carpet cleaning as an added service.
The industry offers standard services to residential and commercial customers, such as: carpet cleaning, upholstery cleaning, ventilation and air duct cleaning, damage repair services

Increased household formation rates have fueled industry expansion. Operators in industries that largely rely on the residential market have more clients available due to an increase in the number of occupied residences.

Due to the lack of many significant companies, the industry is quite competitive. Small businesses are finding it harder and harder to succeed in the market. Businesses need to be innovative and offer distinctive services to stand out from the competition.
Low market share concentration exists in the carpet cleaning industry. Most businesses in the sector only have one or two employees, despite the work being largely manual.

The industry doesn't receive any particular support from the government in the form of subsidies or other governmental aid. The main regulatory concern is the proper disposal of wastewater generated while washing carpets, since many chemicals used contain powerful disinfectants, enzymes, and are strongly acidic and aggressive.

Cost structures are affected by the size of the operator, production volume, and type of carpet cleaning. Larger businesses gain from economies of scale and have more negotiating power with suppliers. Despite fierce price-based competition, the industry maintains a relatively good profit margin.
Small businesses can successfully compete in local markets, but large enterprises have an advantage in providing customers with different locations.

The Southeast, West, Great Lakes, and Mid-Atlantic have the highest concentration of businesses in the industry. The distribution is mostly determined by the number of households and regional median income levels.

The industry primarily offers home and commercial carpet cleaning services to clients in both the consumer and business sectors. Additionally, business owners offer a huge variety of support services.
According to data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics, market segmentation for services offered by the carpet cleaning business is mostly based on household income levels in the United States.

market_segmentation.segment: Households in the highest income quintile
market_segmentation.segment_description: Due to their higher discretionary income and propensity to use professional carpet cleaners more frequently than households in lower income quintiles, these households are the biggest consumers of residential carpet cleaning services. Furthermore, households in this quintile are more likely to spend money on ancillary services, such as building cleaning, home cleaning and expert swimming pool cleaning, among others.

Most office buildings, hotels and many full-service eateries have carpeting that needs to be cleaned on a regular basis. Businesses with carpets in their building will hire expert carpet cleaners at least once a year to maintain the establishments' appearance. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, which has elevated cleaning and sanitizing to the top of customers' and employees' worries, this market segment has grown recently. Commercial customers are now cleaning and sanitizing more frequently, which is good for business.

market_segmentation.segment: Households in the lowest income quintile
market_segmentation.segment_description: Families in this income range mainly make less than $20,000 a year, which means they have less money available to spend on domestic services. As general employment fell over the period, this segment's spending on home services was reduced, which restricted its ability to pay for discretionary purchases.

products_and_services.product_description: Every one to two years, carpets in homes need to be cleaned. Operators in the sector mostly employ steam cleaning, shampooing, bonnet cleaning, foam cleaning and dry cleaning techniques. Spraying a hot water cleaning solution on the carpet and immediately using a wet vacuum to remove the water and any dissolved soil is known as steam cleaning, also known as hot water extraction.

The most popular commercial carpet cleaning techniques include shampooing, steam cleaning and dry cleaning. Commercial carpet cleaning uses a dry cleaning or dry absorbent compound cleaning more frequently than residential carpet cleaning. As new business development and higher commercial building boosted the potential client base for industry operators, the total need for commercial carpet cleaning services has constantly climbed. Commercial carpet cleaners profited from an increase in sanitation services and more frequent cleanings as sanitation and health services have grown in importance to businesses reopening and employees returning to the workplace in recent years.

Industry operators also make a sizeable portion of their income by offering offsite cleaning services in addition to on-site residential and commercial cleaning services. These services frequently feature centrally located carpet, rug, furniture, and upholstery cleaning. Industry professionals typically employ hot water extraction, steam cleaning, and dry-cleaning techniques.

tier_1_suppliers: Soap & Cleaning Compound Manufacturing in the US
Pump & Compressor Manufacturing in the US
SUV & Light Truck Manufacturing in the US
Power Tools & Other General Purpose Machinery Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Chemical Product Manufacturing in the US
Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
Organic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
Circuit Board & Electronic Component Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for carpet cleaning is dependent on trends in discretionary consumer income and spending. For example, when per capita disposable income rises, consumers have more cash on hand to spend on discretionary services, such as professional carpet cleaning. In 2023, per capita disposable income is going to increase, representing a potential opportunity for the industry.

The industry provides carpet cleaning services to the residential housing market. Consumers typically pay for professional carpet cleaning every one to two years. Therefore, a greater number of households creates a larger client base for the industry, positively affecting industry revenue. The number of households is increasing in 2023.

A significant portion of the industry's revenue comes from commercial clients that purchase carpet cleaning services for their business establishments. Office buildings, hotels, banks, airports and restaurants are some of the primary businesses that use professional carpet cleaning services. When the number of businesses operating in the United States rises, there is greater demand for commercial carpet cleaning services. In 2023, the number of businesses is going to increase.

Trends in the national unemployment rate are negatively correlated with changes in industry revenue. With heightened unemployment, consumers typically stretch out the amount of time between service appointments or even opt for do-it-yourself (DIY) carpet cleaning options, negatively affecting industry revenue. The unemployment rate is increasing in 2023. This may be a potential threat to the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The United States' most populous region is the Southeast, which also has the highest concentration of carpet cleaning businesses. There is a bigger need for expert carpet cleaning services because there are more homes and businesses in the area. Florida has the largest percentage of business establishments in the Southeast.

The second-highest percentage of businesses is found in the West. California is the Western state with the highest concentration of industrial establishments. The West region has more carpet cleaning businesses than the national average for a number of reasons, including population density and income levels. Additionally, the median income in both California and Nevada is higher than the national average, which results in a larger potential market and stronger demand for industry services.
The third-largest region for carpet cleaning businesses is the Great Lakes. Given the sizeable amount of population in the area, the area is a desirable location for carpet cleaning businesses.

The largest concentration of business establishments is in New York. Due to its sizable urban areas, the Mid-Atlantic boasts some of the highest populations in the United States. The region also has higher-than-average income levels. Given that households within the region have a larger amount of disposable income, they are more likely to purchase carpet cleaning services and a greater array of auxiliary services provided by the industry.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Since many of the currently used chemicals contain highly alkaline and aggressive enzymes and disinfectants that, if used or managed improperly, can harm individuals and the environment, businesses must abide by all occupational, safety and health requirements.
Operators complied with additional rules on the usage of personal protective equipment and social separation directives during the COVID-19 pandemic.

basis_points.basis_title: Pricing, service level, speed, and other services
basis_points.basis_description: Industry players compete primarily on the basis of pricing, service level, speed, and other services provided.
The primary source of external competition for the industry is janitorial service providers that add carpet cleaning as an added service.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 3 companies have less than 5% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The top three companies in the industry are forecast to produce less than 5.0% of the industry's revenue based on the most recent data available.
IBISWorld reports that 72.3% of industry establishments employ fewer than five workers since the services offered do not necessitate a significant workforce.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Buying storefronts, cleaning supplies and transportation vehicles are examples of capital investments in the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Different cleaning services require different supplies
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Operators in the industry may provide cleaning services such as steam cleaning, dry cleaning, bonnet cleaning, shampoo cleaning or foam cleaning, all of which may require somewhat different cleaning agents.
The cost of various cleaning supplies increased in tandem with the rise in demand for household and commercial cleaning services, increasing the revenue from sales.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Skilled labor force boosts wage cost
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages account for a substantial amount of expenses because the industry has a high proportion of labor-intensive work. There are normally only one or two people needed per location for carpet cleaners, depending on the size of the business.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit varies based on company size
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The profit margin will vary based on the size of a company's operations; in this industry, larger businesses benefit from economies of scale to have a higher profit margin and lower costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Transportation and fuel costs impact profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The transportation and fuel costs are will go down and there will be more demand from businesses and households, which will boost the industry profit margin.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Consumer spending on luxuries boosts profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Operators in the industry will also profit from the continuous rise in consumer expenditure on luxuries such as carpet cleaning.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Impacted by household formation and businesses
volatility_points.volatility_description: Since these variables determine the amount of the industry's clientele, the industry is impacted by the rate of household formation and the number of businesses.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Disposable income and unemployment impact demand
volatility_points.volatility_description: As customers were selected for professional household cleaning services more frequently in the latter half of the present era, rising employment, disposable income and household formation boosted industry demand.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The emergence of cordless and other complex cleaning solutions has been made possible by advancements in automation and battery technology. In addition, compared with earlier times, the advancement of heat-exchange technology has made it possible to use extremely hot cleaning agents.
A chemical and engineering team created DPM Care, a proprietary low-moisture technique that effectively removes stains without harming the carpet or leaving a residue.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche service or bundle its services to attract clients?
FAQs.answer: Carpet cleaning companies commonly offer hardwood floor cleaning and restoration, window, ventilation, air duct and ventilation cleaning.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on rising commercial construction activity?
FAQs.answer: Offices, hotels, stores and restaurants commonly use professional carpet cleaning services. New commercial construction expands the potential client base for carpet cleaners.

FAQs.question: Is maintaining repeat or recurring customers vital to your company's success?
FAQs.answer: Customer satisfaction and maintaining a loyal customer base is vital to success, as office buildings, hotels and many retail locations have carpeting that requires regular cleaning.

FAQs.question: Does your business have to be located near key consumer or client markets?
FAQs.answer: Professional carpet cleaners are typically located in densely populated areas with more than 100,000 households in their direct geographic vicinity or areas of high business concentration.

FAQs.question: Does your business use web-based systems for customer bookings or orders?
FAQs.answer: Most professional carpet cleaners have nearly completely implemented web-based booking systems to manage orders and promote customer satisfaction.

FAQs.question: Does your company use mobile applications to reduce labor costs and improve employee efficiency?
FAQs.answer: Carpet cleaning companies increasingly use GPS vehicle tracking software and systems to manage fleets, map efficient routes to a client's location and control fuel costs.

FAQs.question: Is obtaining state certification or licensing necessary for your business?
FAQs.answer: While trade associations, such as the International Cleaning and Restoration Association, promote cleaning certification, certification and licensing are often not required at the state level.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure the health and safety of its employees?
FAQs.answer: Regulations for the carpet cleaning primarily focus on proper disposal of wastewater, as many of the chemicals used in the cleaning process contain alkaline chemicals and disinfectants, which can cause harm to customers and employees.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
FAQs.answer: It often takes a few weeks for customers to pay on time.

FAQs.question: How do volatile economic conditions affect profit?
FAQs.answer: Profit tends to rise when consumer spending and demand from businesses expands.

FAQs.question: How many of your clients were referred to you by a satisfied client? How can you improve your company to receive better word-of-mouth recommendations?
FAQs.answer: Positive word-of-mouth recommendations generate additional demand from new customers.

FAQs.question: What sets your company apart from competitors? How do you monitor your competitors?
FAQs.answer: In a price-competitive industry, monitoring competitors enables carpet cleaners to adapt their pricing strategy.

FAQs.question: Is your company a part of a franchise? If you are not a part of a franchise, have you considered becoming involved with one?
FAQs.answer: Franchised operations permit companies to increase their brand recognition through expanded networks with reduced capital requirements.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor fluctuations in the national unemployment rate? How is your business directly affected by these changes?
FAQs.answer: With heightened unemployment, consumers typically stretch out the amount of time between service appointments or even opt for do-it-yourself (DIY) carpet cleaning options, negatively affecting revenue.

FAQs.question: Do you find that revenue trends align with the number of households? When the household formation was low,
FAQs.answer: Consumers typically pay for professional carpet cleaning every one to two years. Therefore, a greater number of households creates a larger client base for the industry, positively affecting revenue.

FAQs.question: How have recent trends in household disposable income affected demand for your services? Do you offer any premium services?
FAQs.answer: Demand for carpet cleaning depends on trends in discretionary consumer income and spending. For example, when per capita disposable income rises, consumers have more cash to spend on discretionary services, such as professional carpet cleaning.
